meanings.definition: Injury to body tissues caused by exposure to extreme cold.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the snow without gloves, Tim got frostbite on his fingers.
meanings.sent2: The doctor treated the frostbite on Sarah's nose with warm compresses.
meanings.sent3: The snowman joked that he had frostbite from standing outside all day.
meanings.sent4: The icy wind felt like frostbite on my cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The hiker's frostbite was a painful reminder of the dangers of winter weather.

meanings.definition: To injure body tissues by exposure to extreme cold.
meanings.sent1: Be sure to wear gloves to avoid frostbite when you go skiing.
meanings.sent2: The mountaineer's toes began to frostbite during the blizzard.
meanings.sent3: The frozen popsicle frostbites your tongue if you eat it too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The cold wind seemed to frostbite the delicate flower petals.
meanings.sent5: The Arctic explorers knew the importance of preventing frostbite on their expedition.
